intro: Micromeria × preauxii, commonly known as the hybrid micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and related plants. The species is characterized by its compact stature, small leaves, and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered plant species.
